messages.subject: Re: the f word
messages.msgSnippet: I doesn t bother me. For me, it s just another word. I get bothered when words of any kind are used to hurt though. So You re an idiot! would bother me more
messages.messageBody:
I doesn't bother me. For me, it's just another word. I get bothered when

words of any kind are used to hurt though. So "You're an idiot!" would
bother me more than "What the f**k?" coming out of anyone's mouth. I
know
I'm usually in a minority on this one. Lots of people get bothered by
the
words themselves.

Life is good.
~Mary

I agree totally. I was raised to believe that words are words and
that's it. We attach meaning to them. I don't appreciate name calling
or hurtful talking in our house, but swear words (shit, fuck, damn,
etc...) even the kids say these. We have discussions about appropriate
times and places, but they know they are ok to use. The result? They
rarely use them, but when they do it is definitely in context.
